titles.title: California School Lands Act of 1988
A bill entitled the "California School Lands Act of 1988".

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary: 5/9/1988--Introduced. California School Lands Act of 1988 - Conveys title to specified school lands located within Naval Petroleum Reserve Numbered 1 (Elk Hills) to the State of California, subject to certain restrictions. Requires all money received by the United States from such Reserve to be paid into the Treasury for disbursement as provided in the Mineral Leasing Act and to be treated as money received from sales, bonuses, royalties, and rentals of the public lands.
